report_title: Bubble Tea Shops in the US
executive_summary: The Bubble Tea Shops industry has benefited from the boba craze among young individuals over the past five years. Serving as a comfort drink, bubble teas are available in various flavors and toppings, allowing the industry to reach a broader range of customers. As a result, industry revenue has expanded an annualized 9.1% to $2.6 billion over the five years to 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Boba is the New Drink of the Young Generation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Bubble teas are described as "sweet teas in a thick Styrofoam cup, mixed with non-dairy creamer, ice and a spoonful of black tapioca pearls," according to Clarissa Wei in an article by LA Weekly. The history of bubble tea in the United States traces back to the Immigration and Nationality Act of 1965, which removed the policy restricting the entry of Asians. As a result, a wave of Taiwanese immigrants entered the country and brought their food culture.

Nowadays, boba, which bubble teas are usually called, is no longer just popular among the Asian community. The popularity of bubble tea surged in 2013 due to the Fung Brothers' "Bobalife" song. As the song went viral, more people became interested in bubble tea.
Besides conventional bubble teas, bubble tea chains have increasingly offered various fusion bubble teas. Thus, bubble teas have grown to include

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Coronavirus Hurt and Supported the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: During COVID-19, social distancing protocols forced bubble tea shops to temporarily close for dine-in services. Therefore, they operated with delivery and pickup services only. To the industry's benefit, many boba stores offer takeout services, which are also their core revenue source. Therefore, these shops benefited from a surge in demand for take-out boba.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Boba Tea Shops Respond to the Rising Health-Consciousness
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While rising per capita, tea consumption supports industry demand, an expected increase in the healthy eating index will likely dampen demand for bubble teas. In response, many bubble tea shops let customers adjust sugar levels. Similarly, chains such as Boba Guys enable customers to swap dairy milk for plant-based milk.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry sell bubble tea, a Taiwanese tea-based drink with a variety of toppings, such as chewy tapioca balls.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Per capita tea consumption
threats: Low Outlier Growth: Consumer confidence index

key_trends: The industry is highly competitive. Barriers to entry have been lowered through franchise agreements, in which large bubble tea chains provide franchisees with brand recognition and recipes.
Consistent and prompt delivery of ingredients is critical in ensuring the bubble tea's quality. Besides, some bubble tea chains source ingredients from overseas suppliers.
There are a few large bubble tea chains that dominate the industry. Prominent brand names include but are not limited to Gong Cha, Kung Fu Tea, Boba Guys and Tiger Sugar.
Bubble tea is highly substitutable. Price-sensitive customers have increasingly opted for packaged milk tea sold in supermarkets.

The Bubble Tea Shops industry has blossomed over the past five years. The affordability, convenience and variety of bubble tea have bolstered strong demand from customers in many age groups, especially younger demographics.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Bubble teas are most popular among young demographics. One of the main reasons is that customers in this age group are less health-conscious than those in the older age group.
The high sugar content in milk tea, pearls, and milk foam makes bubble tea less desirable for customers in older groups.

Despite having strongest demand for bubble teas, customers in this age group have restricted income to spend on bubble teas. Nonetheless, these customers are demand drivers. Also, they are willing to try new and exotic flavors, which is important when introducing a new product.

Unlike young adults, individuals in this age group also have less demand to spend time with friends at bubble tea stores. However, these individuals are likely to have children and grandchildren, who have strong demand for bubble teas.

products_and_services.product_description: Tapioca pearls, or boba, is a topping with a chewy texture and sweet flavor.

tier_1_suppliers: Dairy Product Production in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Soft Drink, Baked Goods & Other Grocery Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand for Green and Black Tea Rises Following Higher Health Consciousness
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Many customers have completely foregone milk and opted for options such as green and black tea because they are perceived to have antioxidant and immunity-boosting properties, spurring demand from health-conscious customers.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Bubble Tea Shops Also Sell Other Beverages
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Oolong and Earl Grey teas are also among the top-selling beverages in the industry, but they do not fall into the black or green tea category. Bubble tea stores also sell slushies and coffee to diversify their revenue streams.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Bubble Tea Shops industry's revenue performance depends on active consumer spending.
demand_determinants.determinant_description: With more disposable income, consumers are more likely to purchase bubble teas this industry offers.

basis_points.basis_description: Barriers to entry have been lowered through franchise agreements, in which large bubble tea chains provide franchisees with brand recognition and recipes.
Consistent and prompt delivery of ingredients is critical in ensuring the bubble tea's quality.
Some bubble tea chains source ingredients from overseas suppliers.
There are a few large bubble tea chains that dominate the industry. Prominent brand names include but are not limited to Gong Cha, Kung Fu Tea, Boba Guys and Tiger Sugar
Bubble tea is highly substitutable. Price-sensitive customers have increasingly opted for packaged milk tea sold in supermarkets.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit Varies Depending Upon the Business Size
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit has declined despite increased consumer spending and growth in per capita tea consumption because the price of milk, a key ingredient, has increased over the past five years.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Prime Locations are Important for Bubble Tea Shops
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Rent expenses are high for the industry because of the need for locations in high-traffic areas with high visibility. There is high competition for high-traffic locations among industry operators, so they often run at a premium.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: The Largest Cost for Industry Operators is the Cost of Purchases.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Ingredients such as teas, milk and tapioca pearls are usually purchased from wholesalers, particularly those that guarantee prompt delivery and high quality. Fluctuations in the cost of food significantly affect industry profit.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Many product offerings include cold beverages.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: BUBBLE TEA SHOPS HAVE INNOVATED TOPPING OFFERINGS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: As the boba craze has somewhat slowed down after many US customers became accustomed to milk tea, the introduction of brown sugar milk tea has again boosted industry demand. Similarly, the invention of salted milk foam has provided bubble tea shops with a new revenue stream.

FAQs.question: What are the key data points covered in the industry data table?
FAQs.answer: The data table provides yearly data from 2005 to 2018 on revenue, enterprises, establishments, employment, wages, IVA (value added), imports, and exports for the industry.

FAQs.question: What is the highest revenue figure shown in the data?
FAQs.answer: The highest revenue figure shown is $1,406 million in 2018.

FAQs.question: What is the highest number of enterprises listed?
FAQs.answer: The highest number of enterprises listed is 511 in 2018.

FAQs.question: What is the highest employment figure given?
FAQs.answer: The highest employment figure given is 1,652 in 2018.

FAQs.question: Are import and export values provided in the data?
FAQs.answer: No, the import and export columns have '-' or blank values, indicating this data is not provided.
